title: Parler Returns to Google Play Store
description: Google said that Parler had more robust content moderation practices than it did when it was banned in the aftermath of the Jan. 6 riot.

title: AI-Generated Art Won a Prize. Artists Aren’t Happy.
description: “I won, and I didn’t break any rules,” the artwork’s creator says.

title: Amid Heat Wave, California Asks Electric Vehicle Owners to Limit Charging
description: Critics of the state’s push to end reliance on gas-powered vehicles seized on the news. But environmentalists said the extreme weather underscored the need for the E.V. transition.

title: On Truth Social, Trump Embraces Far-Right Conspiracy Theories
description: The former president’s activity on his social network, Truth Social, openly promotes far-right and conspiratorial ideas that are usually confined to corners of the internet.

title: The Flaw in Biden’s Pro-Labor Record: Uber Drivers Are Still Waiting for Help
description: The administration’s plans to strengthen their labor protections have been slowed by Congress, the courts and a lobbying blitz.

title: A Solar Firm Plans to Build Off-Grid Neighborhoods in California
description: Sunnova Energy is seeking permission from state regulators to develop microgrids for new housing developments that would not be reliant on established electric utilities.

title: Labor Board Official Says Amazon Effort to Overturn Staten Island Warehouse Election Should Be Rejected
description: The labor official concluded that Amazon’s objections to the election should be set aside and that the Amazon Labor Union should be certified to represent workers at the warehouse.
